description: A type of fastener characterized by a helical ridge, known as a thread, which is wrapped around a cylinder. Screws are used to hold objects together and can be driven into materials using a screwdriver or drill.

types.name: Wood screw
types.description: A screw designed for use in wood, featuring a sharp point and coarse threads to grip the wood fibers.

types.name: Machine screw
types.description: A screw with a uniform diameter and fine threads, used with nuts or tapped holes.

types.name: Self-tapping screw
types.description: A screw that can tap its own hole as it is driven into the material, eliminating the need for a pre-drilled hole.

types.name: Sheet metal screw
types.description: A screw designed for fastening metal sheets, featuring sharp threads and a pointed tip.

types.name: Lag screw
types.description: A heavy-duty screw used for fastening large wooden structures, requiring a wrench for installation.

types.name: Deck screw
types.description: A corrosion-resistant screw designed for outdoor decking applications, often featuring a special coating.

types.name: Drywall screw
types.description: A fine-threaded screw used for attaching drywall to wooden or metal studs.

types.name: Concrete screw
types.description: A hardened steel screw designed for anchoring into concrete, masonry, or brick.

types.name: Set screw
types.description: A screw used to secure an object within or against another object, typically without a head.

types.name: Thumb screw
types.description: A screw with a knurled head that can be tightened or loosened by hand, without the need for tools.

types.name: Socket screw
types.description: A screw with a hexagonal socket in the head, designed to be driven by an Allen wrench or hex key.

types.name: Cap screw
types.description: A screw with a cylindrical head and a hexagonal drive, used for fastening parts together.

types.name: Square drive screw
types.description: A screw with a square-shaped socket in the head, designed to be driven by a square drive bit.

types.name: Security screw
types.description: A screw designed with a unique drive pattern to prevent unauthorized removal, often used in public installations.

types.name: Woodruff key screw
types.description: A screw that incorporates a Woodruff key to prevent rotation in applications where rotational force is applied.

types.name: Tapping screw
types.description: A screw designed to create its own thread in a pre-drilled hole, often used in metal applications.

types.name: Binder screw
types.description: A screw used to bind or hold together multiple sheets of material, often found in binders or folders.

types.name: Chipboard screw
types.description: A screw specifically designed for use in chipboard or particle board, featuring coarse threads for better grip.
